text:
“Perhaps this will mean the end?” Raskolnikov thought. 

Porfiry entered quietly. 

“You didn’t expect a visitor, Rodion Romanovitch,” he laughed. 

“Sit down, Porfiry Petrovitch, sit down,” Raskolnikov said, surprised at his own friendliness. 

The moment had come. 

Raskolnikov faced Porfiry, unflinching. 

“Speak, speak,” he urged silently. 

Porfiry lit a cigarette, eyes narrowed. 

“Why don’t you speak?” Raskolnikov’s heart raced.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov experiences a mix of anticipation and dread as he confronts Porfiry, who unexpectedly visits him.
